Get all models with pending deployment flags and active downloads for UI state recovery.

This endpoint is used by the frontend to recover state after page reloads when 
download/deploy operations were in progress.

Returns:
    dict: {
        "pending_deployments": [model_repo_ids],  # Models waiting for deployment
        "downloading_models": [model_repo_ids],   # Models currently downloading
        "deployment_flags": {model_id: flag_value},  # Raw etcd flags
        "active_downloads": [download_info],         # Detailed download info
        "total_pending": int,
        "total_downloading": int
    }

schema.title: Response Get Pending Deployments Models Pending Deployments Get

post.description:
Manually clean up stale deployment flags in etcd.

This endpoint removes deployment flags for models that:
- Have deployment requested (flag = "true")
- But have no active downloads (is_downloading OR dl_requested_at)
- And are not currently deployed

Returns:
    dict: {
        "cleaned_count": int,
        "cleaned_flags": [model_ids],
        "message": str
    }

schema.title: Response Cleanup Stale Deployments Models Cleanup Stale Deployments Post

post.description:
Estimate the VRAM required for a model deployment. If Ray is initialized, runs estimation
on the node with the model files. Otherwise falls back to local estimation.

Leverages globalizer to distribute to the correct node.

Args:
    deployment_request (CreateModelDeployment): The deployment request containing model configuration.

Returns:
    Dict[str, float]: A dictionary containing the computed VRAM estimate and the highest node VRAM.

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the model is not found or estimation fails.

get.description:
Get dataset by URN using query parameter. 

RECOMMENDED for complex URNs with forward slashes.
Example: GET /catalog/datasets/by-urn?urn=urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:file,/var/tmp/docs,PROD)

patch.description: Update dataset by URN using query parameter.

delete.description: Delete dataset by URN using query parameter.

get.description:
Get schema by URN using query parameter.

RECOMMENDED for complex URNs with forward slashes.
Example: GET /catalog/datasets/by-urn/schema?urn=urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:file,/var/tmp/docs,PROD)

put.description: Update schema by URN using query parameter.

get.description:
Get dataset by URN in path (BACKWARD COMPATIBLE).

NOTE: URNs with forward slashes should use /by-urn endpoint instead.
For path usage, ensure proper URL encoding:
- Single encode: %2F for /
- May require double encoding for complex URNs: %252F

Example: GET /catalog/datasets/urn%3Ali%3Adataset%3A(urn%3Ali%3AdataPlatform%3Afile%2Csimple-name%2CPROD)

patch.description: Update dataset by URN in path (BACKWARD COMPATIBLE).

delete.description: Delete dataset by URN in path (BACKWARD COMPATIBLE).

get.description:
Get dataset by URN using regex-based path converter (V2 - RECOMMENDED).

This endpoint properly handles DataHub URNs with forward slashes using custom regex matching.
Supports all URN complexities while maintaining clean RESTful URLs.

Example: GET /catalog/datasets/v2/urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:file,/var/tmp/docs,PROD)

patch.description:
Update dataset by URN using regex-based path converter (V2 - RECOMMENDED).

Example: PATCH /catalog/datasets/v2/urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:file,/var/tmp/docs,PROD)

delete.description:
Delete dataset by URN using regex-based path converter (V2 - RECOMMENDED).

Example: DELETE /catalog/datasets/v2/urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:file,/var/tmp/docs,PROD)

get.description:
Get schema by URN using regex-based path converter (V2 - RECOMMENDED).

This endpoint properly handles DataHub URNs with forward slashes including sub-resources.

Example: GET /catalog/datasets/v2/urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:file,/var/tmp/docs,PROD)/schema

put.description:
Update schema by URN using regex-based path converter (V2 - RECOMMENDED).

Example: PUT /catalog/datasets/v2/urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:file,/var/tmp/docs,PROD)/schema

schema.title: Response Stop Deployment Apps Deployment  Deployment Id  Delete

delete.description:
Stop and completely remove an app deployment.

Requires authentication and ownership verification. Users can only purge
their own deployments unless they have admin role.

Admin cross-user purges are rate limited to prevent abuse and ensure
proper audit trails are maintained.

Args:
    deployment_id (UUID): The ID of the deployment to purge.
    current_user: Authenticated user (injected by dependency)

Returns:
    bool: True if successfully purged.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 403 if user doesn't own the deployment and isn't admin
    HTTPException: 404 if deployment doesn't exist
    HTTPException: 429 if admin rate limit exceeded
    HTTPException: 500 if purge operation fails

schema.title: Response Purge Deployment Apps Deployment  Deployment Id  Purge Delete

post.description:
Record a heartbeat for an app session token.

Token should be provided in one of:
- Authorization header: "Bearer <token>"
- X-App-Session-Token header: "<token>"
- Request body: {"session_token": "<token>"}

End an app session token and purge the associated deployment.

Token should be provided in one of:
- Authorization header: "Bearer <token>"
- X-App-Session-Token header: "<token>"
- Request body: {"session_token": "<token>", "reason": "..."}

Deploy a new Tool server from a Docker image.

This endpoint creates a new Tool deployment and returns a public HTTPS URL
that can be used with any Tool-compatible client.

Args:
    request: Deployment configuration including Docker image and environment variables
    current_user: Authenticated user (injected)

Returns:
    ToolDeployment: Deployment details including the generated public URL

Raises:
    HTTPException: If deployment fails

Deploy a Tool server from a pre-built template.

This is a convenience endpoint that combines template lookup and deployment.

Args:
    template_name: Name of the template (e.g., "tool-websearch")
    name: Name for your deployment instance
    env_vars: Optional environment variables (e.g., API keys)
    current_user: Authenticated user (injected)

Returns:
    ToolDeployment: Deployment details including the generated public URL

Example:
    POST /tool/deploy-template/tool-websearch
    {
        "name": "my-search-tool",
        "env_vars": {
            "TAVILY_API_KEY": "your-api-key"
        }
    }

get.description:
Get public security configuration.

Returns configuration needed by the frontend to render:
- Pre-login consent gate (if enabled)
- Classification banners (if enabled)

This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

Returns:
    SecurityConfigResponse: Configuration object containing:
        - consent_enabled: Whether consent gate is active
        - consent_content: HTML content for consent modal (if enabled)
        - banner_enabled: Whether classification banners are active
        - banner_text: Text to display in banners (if enabled)
        - banner_color: Hex color code for banners (if enabled)

post.description:
Record consent acceptance.

Records that a user has accepted the consent terms. This is logged
for audit purposes with client IP and user agent.

This endpoint is public as it must be accessible before login.

Args:
    request: FastAPI Request object used to extract client IP and user agent.

Returns:
    ConsentAcceptResponse: Confirmation object containing:
        - accepted: Boolean indicating consent was recorded
        - message: Status message

get.description:
Get embeddable JavaScript bundle for classification banners and consent gate.

Returns a self-contained JavaScript file that apps can include to
automatically display classification banners and enforce consent acceptance.
The script:
- Fetches security configuration from this API
- Shows consent gate overlay if consent is required and not yet accepted
- Injects CSS for banner and consent gate styling
- Creates banner elements at top and bottom of page
- Implements fail-closed behavior (shows consent gate on config failure)
- Sanitizes HTML content to prevent XSS attacks

Usage in apps:
    <script src="https://kamiwaza-host/api/security/embed.js"></script>

Security features:
- Consent acceptance tracked via sessionStorage (per-session)
- Consent acceptance logged to backend for audit purposes
- Escape key disabled while consent gate is displayed
- HTML content sanitized before rendering (strips dangerous tags/attributes)
- Fail-closed: If config fetch fails, shows consent gate with Retry button

Returns:
    Response: JavaScript file with content-type application/javascript.
        Cached for 5 minutes via Cache-Control header.

storage_host.description: Host where the file is stored. Uses localhost for community edition, actual hostname for clustered mode

storage_location.title: Storage Location
storage_location.description: The location path or key where the file is stored

id.title: Id
id.description: Primary key for the model file.

hub.title: Hub
hub.description: The hub where the model file is located. eg, 'HubsHf'; not in create because we expect this to not be done via api typically.

model_id.title: Model Id
model_id.description: The id of the model (model is a reserved word)

checksum.title: Checksum
checksum.description: The checksum of the model file for verification.

checksum_type.title: Checksum Type
checksum_type.description: The type of checksum used to verify the model file - for hf, typically sha1 for git-sha or sha256 for kamiwaza/git-lfs

created_timestamp.title: Created Timestamp
created_timestamp.description: The timestamp when the model file was created in the database.

is_downloading.title: Is Downloading
is_downloading.description: Indicates whether the download is or was in progress.

download_pid.title: Download Pid
download_pid.description: The process ID (PID) of the download process.

download_process_start_time.title: Download Process Start Time
download_process_start_time.description: The start time of the download process (Unix timestamp) for PID validation.

download.title: Download
download.description: Indicates whether the file has been flagged by a user for downloading or not. This accounts for models that have various weight files for different quants, etc.

dl_requested_at.title: Dl Requested At
dl_requested_at.description: The time the download was requested.

download_node.title: Download Node
download_node.description: The node where the download is happening.

download_percentage.title: Download Percentage
download_percentage.description: The percentage of the download that has been completed.

download_elapsed.title: Download Elapsed
download_elapsed.description: The time elapsed during the download.

download_remaining.title: Download Remaining
download_remaining.description: The time remaining during the download.

download_throughput.title: Download Throughput
download_throughput.description: The download throughput (human readable, units vary)

download_cancelled_at.title: Download Cancelled At
download_cancelled_at.description: The timestamp when the download was cancelled.

ModelFile.title: ModelFile
ModelFile.description: A model file, after creation (meaning it includes an RESTful id)

use_case.title: Use Case
use_case.description: Use case(s) - string or array (General Use, Reasoning, Vision/MultiModal, Roleplaying)

size_category.title: Size Category
size_category.description: Size category: small, medium, large, very_large

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier for the model guide entry

ModelGuide.title: ModelGuide
ModelGuide.description: Schema for a model guide entry after creation, including RESTful id and timestamps.

deployed_at.title: Deployed At
deployed_at.description: Time at which the instance was deployed

node_id.title: Node Id
node_id.description: Node ID where the instance is running

listen_port.title: Listen Port
listen_port.description: Port on which the instance is listening

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: Target platform(s): Mac, GPU, Fast CPU, etc. Can be string or list of strings

variant_type.title: Variant Type
variant_type.description: Variant type: gguf, awq, gptq, mlx, fp16, fp8, etc

minimum_vram.title: Minimum Vram
minimum_vram.description: Minimum VRAM in GB (0 for CPU only)

recommended_vram.title: Recommended Vram
recommended_vram.description: Recommended VRAM in GB (0 for CPU only)

speed_rating.title: Speed Rating
speed_rating.description: Speed rating: very_fast, fast, medium, slow

quality_penalty.title: Quality Penalty
quality_penalty.description: Quality penalty vs base model (0-10 scale)

novice_config.title: Novice Config
novice_config.description: Optional Novice-mode configuration settings for this variant

content.title: Content
content.description: The markdown content of the news item

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if news fetch failed

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: When this news content was retrieved

NewsContent.title: NewsContent
NewsContent.description:
Pydantic model for news content returned from the API.
Legacy model for backward compatibility.

example.content:
## Latest Kamiwaza Updates

### Kamiwaza 2.2.0 Released
*January 10, 2025*

Major update with improved model deployment, enhanced UI, and better performance monitoring.

### New Model Support
*January 5, 2025*

Added support for **Llama 3.3**, **DeepSeek V3**, and **Qwen 2.5** series models.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for the news item

content.title: Content
content.description: Markdown content of the news item

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Tags associated with the news item

version.title: Version
version.description: Version of the news feed format

lastUpdated.title: Lastupdated
lastUpdated.description: When the news was last updated

quadrants.title: Quadrants
quadrants.description: Quadrant layout with grouped news items

last_seen.title: Last Seen
last_seen.description: Last time the node was seen via Ray

last_config.title: Last Config
last_config.description: Last Ray configuration of the node

Node.title: Node
Node.description: Node schema representing a DB-saved snapshot of a ray node.

NodeDetails.title: NodeDetails
NodeDetails.description: Pydantic model representing detailed information of a node, including its relationships and Ray details.

NodeListNode.title: NodeListNode
NodeListNode.description: Node schema for a ray node in the cluster

ttl_seconds.title: Ttl Seconds
ttl_seconds.description: TTL in seconds for the PAT

ttl_seconds.title: Ttl Seconds
ttl_seconds.description: TTL in seconds for the PAT

is_primary.title: Is Primary
is_primary.description: Whether this is the primary port for Traefik routing

tenant_id.title: Tenant Id
tenant_id.description: Optional tenant identifier for the relationship

names.title: Names
names.description: Specific template names to sync. If None, syncs all missing templates.

RemoteSyncRequest.title: RemoteSyncRequest
RemoteSyncRequest.description:
Request to sync templates from remote catalog.

Used by POST /apps/app_templates/remote/sync to import templates.
If names is None, syncs all missing templates.

RemoteSyncStage.title: RemoteSyncStage
RemoteSyncStage.description:
Remote template catalog environment stages.

Used to select which remote catalog URL to sync templates from.
LOCAL uses configurable URL, others use fixed Kamiwaza infrastructure.

RetrievalJob.title: RetrievalJob
RetrievalJob.description: Response payload when a job is created.

RetrievalJobStatus.title: RetrievalJobStatus
RetrievalJobStatus.description: Status payload for polling job progress.

limit_rows.title: Limit Rows
limit_rows.description: Maximum number of rows to materialise (if applicable)

credential_override.title: Credential Override
credential_override.description: Caller-provided credential to access the dataset

batch_size.title: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Preferred batch size for streaming transports

sdk_session.title: Sdk Session
sdk_session.description: Identifier supplied by the SDK to aid telemetry

RetrievalRequest.title: RetrievalRequest
RetrievalRequest.description: Request payload for starting a retrieval job.

Secret.title: Secret
Secret.description:
Full secret schema including system-generated fields.

Note: value and owner may not be present in all DataHub responses
(e.g., list operations or when metadata-only is returned)

SecretCreate.title: SecretCreate
SecretCreate.description: Schema for creating a new secret - only includes fields that users provide

consent_enabled.title: Consent Enabled
consent_enabled.description: Whether the pre-login consent gate is enabled

consent_content.title: Consent Content
consent_content.description: HTML content for the consent modal (only included if consent is enabled)

consent_button_label.title: Consent Button Label
consent_button_label.description: Custom label for the consent accept button

banner_top_text.title: Banner Top Text
banner_top_text.description: Text to display in top banner

banner_top_color.title: Banner Top Color
banner_top_color.description: Hex color code for top banner background

banner_bottom_text.title: Banner Bottom Text
banner_bottom_text.description: Text to display in bottom banner

banner_bottom_color.title: Banner Bottom Color
banner_bottom_color.description: Hex color code for bottom banner background

SecurityConfigResponse.title: SecurityConfigResponse
SecurityConfigResponse.description:
Public security configuration returned to frontend.

This is the response schema for GET /api/security/public/config.
Contains all settings needed by the UI to render consent gate
and classification banners.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of what this capability does

ToolCapability.title: ToolCapability
ToolCapability.description: Represents a capability or tool provided by a Tool server.

template_id.title: Template Id
template_id.description: The UUID of the app template to use

requested_at.title: Requested At
requested_at.description: Time at which the deployment was requested

deployed_at.title: Deployed At
deployed_at.description: Time at which the deployment was started

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Time at which the deployment was created

compose_yml.title: Compose Yml
compose_yml.description: The docker-compose YML from the template

min_copies.title: Min Copies
min_copies.description: Minimum number of copies to maintain

url.title: Url
url.description: Public HTTPS URL for the Tool server

ToolDeployment.title: ToolDeployment
ToolDeployment.description: Response model for Tool deployment with generated URL.

ToolDiscovery.title: ToolDiscovery
ToolDiscovery.description: Response for Tool server discovery endpoint.

ToolHealthCheck.title: ToolHealthCheck
ToolHealthCheck.description: Health check response for Tool servers.

url.title: Url
url.description: Public URL for the Tool server

ToolServerInfo.title: ToolServerInfo
ToolServerInfo.description: Information about a deployed Tool server.

TransportType.title: TransportType
TransportType.description: Transport strategies supported by the retrieval service.

remote_host.title: Remote Host
remote_host.description: Hostname or IP of the paired GPU node

remote_user.title: Remote User
remote_user.description: SSH username for the paired node

ssh_key_path.title: Ssh Key Path
ssh_key_path.description: Path to the SSH private key on the head node

models_root.title: Models Root
models_root.description: Model storage root on the paired node

strict_host_key_checking.title: Strict Host Key Checking
strict_host_key_checking.description: Enforce strict SSH host key checking

additional_env.title: Additional Env
additional_env.description: Additional environment variables to set before remote commands

TwoNodeAttachRequest.title: TwoNodeAttachRequest
TwoNodeAttachRequest.description: Request payload for attaching a paired GPU node in two-node mode.

m_id.title: M Id
m_id.description: The UUID of the model to deploy

m_file_id.title: M File Id
m_file_id.description: Which weights file to use for models with >1 set of weights (eg, multi-quant GPTQ models)

m_config_id.title: M Config Id
m_config_id.description: The UUID of the ModelConfig to use for this deployment

engine_name.title: Engine Name
engine_name.description: Name of the engine to use for deployment

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration in minutes for which the model should be deployed; default indefinite

min_copies.title: Min Copies
min_copies.description: Minimum number of copies to maintain; if set to 0 will dynamically reactivate

starting_copies.title: Starting Copies
starting_copies.description: Number of copies to start with

location.title: Location
location.description: Location where the model is to be deployed

lb_port.title: Lb Port
lb_port.description: Port on which the load balancer is listening

force_cpu.title: Force Cpu
force_cpu.description: Whether to force CPU usage; not required on Ampere systems without accelerators; otherwise expected for cpu deployment

node_resource_type.title: Node Resource Type
node_resource_type.description: The specialized gpu node resource; for future use for mixed clusters

max_concurrent_requests.title: Max Concurrent Requests
max_concurrent_requests.description: Maximum number of concurrent requests allowed

vram_allocation.title: Vram Allocation
vram_allocation.description: Not user-settable (ignored); The VRAM allocation, in bytes of vram for each copy of the deployed model

gpu_allocation.title: Gpu Allocation
gpu_allocation.description: Not user-settable (ignored); The GPU allocation, as a percentage of the the total VRAM available on the highest vram node, for ray serve allocation

active_req_per_replica.title: Active Req Per Replica
active_req_per_replica.description: Number of active requests per replica

requested_at.title: Requested At
requested_at.description: Time at which the deployment was requested

deployed_at.title: Deployed At
deployed_at.description: Time at which the deployment was started

serve_path.title: Serve Path
serve_path.description: Ray serve path prefix of the deployment

access_path_prefix.title: Access Path Prefix
access_path_prefix.description: Public path prefix used for ingress routing (e.g., /models)

access_path.title: Access Path
access_path.description: Full public path for this deployment (e.g., /models/{uuid})

single_node_mode.title: Single Node Mode
single_node_mode.description: Whether the deployment is in single node mode, bypassing ray

last_error_code.title: Last Error Code
last_error_code.description: Short error code for last failure (e.g., OOM, CUDA_ERROR, MODEL_LOADING_FAILURE, CONTAINER_EXITED)

instances.title: Instances
instances.description: List of instances associated with the deployment

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Time at which the deployment was created

gpu_memory_utilization.title: Gpu Memory Utilization
gpu_memory_utilization.description: GPU memory utilization as computed or passed by the user (read-only)

tensor_parallel_size.title: Tensor Parallel Size
tensor_parallel_size.description: Tensor parallelism size as computed or passed by the user (read-only)

m_config_name.title: M Config Name
m_config_name.description: Name of the model configuration used for deployment

host_ip.title: Host Ip
host_ip.description: IP address associated with the host_name in case resolution is failing for client

validate_containers.title: Validate Containers
validate_containers.description: If true, attempt to pull / inspect referenced images on update

env_defaults.title: Env Defaults
env_defaults.description: Default environment variables for the template

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the vectordb instance to register

engine.title: Engine
engine.description: The engine of the vectordb instance, eg Milvus

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the vectordb instance

host.title: Host
host.description: The host of the vectordb instance

port.title: Port
port.description: The port of the vectordb instance
